unnormalised: In yesterday's nail-biting match, India clinched victory against Aus with a final score of 245/8, while Aus managed just 240 all out. Virat scored a brilliant 112 off 110 balls, earning him the Man of the Match award.
normalised: In yesterday's nail-biting match, India clinched victory against A-u-s with a final score of two hundred and forty five divided by eight, while A-u-s managed just two hundred and forty all out. Virat scored a brilliant one hundred and twelve off one hundred and ten balls, earning him the Man of the Match award.

unnormalised: Earlier, in the PKL, Patna Pirates defeated Bengal Warriors with a score of 40-35. Pardeep Narwal was on fire, scoring 18 raid points for Patna. The match saw a total of 75 points scored, a thrilling spectacle for the fans.
normalised: Earlier, in the P-K-L, Patna Pirates defeated Bengal Warriors with a score of forty to thirty five. Pardeep Narwal was on fire, scoring eighteen raid points for Patna. The match saw a total of seventy five points scored, a thrilling spectacle for the fans.

unnormalised: Meanwhile, in the local cricket league, the Challengers won their match against the Warriors by 6 wickets. The Warriors scored 150/7, and the Challengers chased it down in 18.2 overs. Rohit Sharma smashed 60 runs in just 40 balls for the Challengers.
normalised: Meanwhile, in the local cricket league, the Challengers won their match against the Warriors by six wickets. The Warriors scored one hundred and fifty divided by seven, and the Challengers chased it down in eighteen point two overs. Rohit Sharma smashed sixty runs in just forty balls for the Challengers.

unnormalised: In football, Mumbai City FC drew 2-2 with Bengaluru FC. Sunil Chhetri scored both goals for Bengaluru, while Igor Angulo and Bipin Singh found the net for Mumbai. The match was full of action, with a total of 4 yellow cards handed out.
normalised: In football, Mumbai City F-C drew two to two with Bengaluru F-C. Sunil Chhetri scored both goals for Bengaluru, while Igor Angulo and Bipin Singh found the net for Mumbai. The match was full of action, with a total of four yellow cards handed out.

unnormalised: Finally, in badminton, PV Sindhu advanced to the next round of the All England Open, defeating her opponent 21-18, 21-15. Her next match is scheduled for 14/03/2024.
normalised: Finally, in badminton, P-V Sindhu advanced to the next round of the All England Open, defeating her opponent twenty one to eighteen, twenty one to fifteen. Her next match is scheduled for fourteenth March two thousand and twenty four.
